symbols.name: sap.me
symbols.description: SAPUI5 library with controls specialized for mobile devices (extension).

nodes.name: sap.me.OverlapCalendar
nodes.description: A calendar that allows to display events in a grid and show the overlapped events

nodes.name: sap.me.OverlapCalendarEvent
nodes.description: Represent the data of an event for the overlap calendar

nodes.name: sap.me.ProgressIndicator
nodes.description: Shows the progress of a process in a graphical way.

nodes.name: sap.me.TabContainer
nodes.description: The TabContainer allow to stack 1 to 4 contents in a view with corresponding icons

symbols.title: namespace sap.me
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.34

symbols.name: sap.me.Calendar

properties.name: currentDate
properties.description: the center date where the month/week will be built around

properties.name: days
properties.description: Array of day names, default value is sap.m.getLocaleData().getDays("abbreviated") Check sap.ui.core.LocaleData documentation for more info.

properties.name: design
properties.description: Indicates the design of the calendar (mainly colors)

properties.name: disabledDates
properties.description: Array of specific dates (strings or Date objects) that will be disabled/non interactive

properties.name: disabledWeekDays
properties.description: Array of weekDays (as integers where 0=Sunday, 1=Monday etc) to be disabled. Interaction will be disabled for these week days.

properties.name: firstDayOffset
properties.description: to offset the first day of the week (0 = sunday)

properties.name: months
properties.description: Array of month names, default value is sap.m.getLocaleData().getMonths("abbreviated") Check sap.ui.core.LocaleData documentation for more info.

properties.name: monthsPerRow
properties.description: months to display in a row. This sets the width of the whole control in order to contain the desired number of months per row

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description: Indicates the design of the calendar (mainly colors)

properties.name: singleRow
properties.description: boolean that sets the view to week mode or month mode

properties.name: swipeToNavigate
properties.description: When enabled, swipe gestures will navigate and not select

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Calendar.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: changeCurrentDate
events.description: event fired when tap to next or previous button and currentDate is updated

events.name: changeRange
events.description: when the range of selected dates changes

events.name: tapOnDate
events.description: event fired when a date is tapped

methods.name: attachChangeCurrentDate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.me.Calendar itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the changeCurrentDate event of this sap.me.Calendar.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.me.Calendar itself.

event fired when tap to next or previous button and currentDate is updated

methods.name: attachChangeRange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.me.Calendar itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the changeRange event of this sap.me.Calendar.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.me.Calendar itself.

when the range of selected dates changes

methods.name: attachTapOnDate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.me.Calendar itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the tapOnDate event of this sap.me.Calendar.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.me.Calendar itself.

event fired when a date is tapped

methods.name: detachChangeCurrentDate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the changeCurrentDate event of this sap.me.Calendar.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: detachChangeRange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the changeRange event of this sap.me.Calendar.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: detachTapOnDate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the tapOnDate event of this sap.me.Calendar.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: sap.me.Calendar.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.me.Calendar with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Control.extend.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

methods.description: Fires event changeCurrentDate to attached listeners.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

parameters.name: mParameters

methods.description: Fires event tapOnDate to attached listeners.

Gets current value of property currentDate.

the center date where the month/week will be built around

returnValue.description: Value of property dayWidth

methods.description:
Gets current value of property dayWidth.

the width of a day

methods.description:
Gets current value of property design.

Indicates the design of the calendar (mainly colors)

methods.description:

Array of weekDays (as integers where 0=Sunday, 1=Monday etc) to be disabled. Interaction will be disabled for these week days.

to enable multiselection feature

methods.description:

to offset the first day of the week (0 = sunday)

methods.description:

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.me.Calendar.

methods.name: getMonths

returnValue.description: Value of property months

methods.description:
Gets current value of property months.

Array of month names, default value is sap.m.getLocaleData().getMonths("abbreviated") Check sap.ui.core.LocaleData documentation for more info.

methods.name: getMonthsPerRow

returnValue.description: Value of property monthsPerRow

methods.description:
Gets current value of property monthsPerRow.

months to display in a row. This sets the width of the whole control in order to contain the desired number of months per row

Default value is 1.

methods.name: getMonthsToDisplay

returnValue.description: Value of property monthsToDisplay

methods.description:
Gets current value of property monthsToDisplay.

number of months in a row.

Default value is 1.

methods.name: getSelectedDates
methods.description: returns an array of the currently selected dates (dates are strings formatted as Date.toDateString())

methods.name: getSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Value of property selectionMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property selectionMode.

Indicates the design of the calendar (mainly colors)

Default value is SINGLE.

methods.name: getSingleRow

returnValue.description: Value of property singleRow

methods.description:
Gets current value of property singleRow.

boolean that sets the view to week mode or month mode

methods.name: getSwipeToNavigate

returnValue.description: Value of property swipeToNavigate

methods.description:
Gets current value of property swipeToNavigate.

When enabled, swipe gestures will navigate and not select

Default value is false.

methods.name: getVisible

returnValue.description: Value of property visible

methods.description:
Gets current value of property visible.

visibility of the control

Default value is true.

methods.name: getWeeksPerRow

returnValue.description: Value of property weeksPerRow

methods.description:
Gets current value of property weeksPerRow.

weeks to display in a row

Default value is 1.

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description:
Gets current value of property width.

The width of the calendar

Default value is 100%.

methods.name: sap.me.Calendar.parseDate

returnValue.description: The Date, parsed from the input string.

parameters.name: strDate
parameters.description: The date, produced by a former call to Date.toDateString.

throws.description: If the string provided does not match a toDateString produced string.

methods.description: Helper function to instantiate a Date from the string(s) provided by the getCurrentDate, getSelectedDates methods. IMPORTANT: The only valid values for the created Date are: year, month, day. Disregard any other value: hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds...

methods.name: setCurrentDate

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: strDate
parameters.description: The Date to set, the format being identical to a date string produced by "toDateString".

methods.description: Sets the current date of the calendar.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

the height of a day

methods.name: toggleDatesRangeSelection

parameters.name: oDateStart
parameters.description: starting date of the range. It can be Strings or Date objects.

parameters.name: oDateEnd
parameters.description: ending date of the range. It can be Strings or Date objects.

parameters.name: bSelected
parameters.description: selected/unselected. Optional, if omitted it inverts each date's current state

methods.description: it toggles the selection of the dates within the passed range to selected/unselected

methods.name: toggleDatesSelection

parameters.name: aDates
parameters.description: Array of the dates to be toggled. they can be Strings or Date objects.

parameters.name: bSelected
parameters.description: select/unselect. Optional, if omitted it inverts each date's current state

methods.description: it toggles the passed dates to selected/unselected

methods.name: toggleDatesType

parameters.name: aDates
parameters.description: An array of dates in string representation

parameters.name: bSelected
parameters.description: Add/remove the type, if ommited it will toggle

methods.description: Change the type of the given dates

methods.name: unselectAllDates
methods.description: unselect all the dates

symbols.title: class sap.me.Calendar
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.26.0
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.26.0. This control was experimental since 1.12. Please use the sap.ui.unified.Calendar instead!

experimental.text: API is not yet finished and might change completely

symbols.name: sap.me.CalendarLegend

properties.description: Indicates if the legend can be collapsed and expanded

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: Indicates if the legend is expanded or not

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new CalendarLegend.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

Creates a new subclass of class sap.me.CalendarLegend with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Control.extend.

symbols.title: class sap.me.CalendarLegend
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.34.0
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.34.0. This control was experimental since 1.12. Please use the sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend instead!

experimental.text: API is not yet finished and might change completely

symbols.name: sap.me.OverlapCalendar
symbols.description: A calendar that allows to display events in a grid and show the overlapped events

properties.name: firstDayOffset
properties.description: Indicate how to offset the first day in regards to a Sunday (by default)

properties.name: showOverlapIndicator
properties.description: Do we want to display the overlap indicator

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: The first date to display for the calendar

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Indicates if we should render this component

aggregations.name: calendarEvents
aggregations.description: The list of events to display in the calendar grid

aggregations.name: typeLabels
aggregations.description: Hidden aggregation of the label for event type

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new OverlapCalendar.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.name: firstDate
parameters.description: The first date displayed in the calendar

parameters.name: lastDate
parameters.description: The last date that will be displayed

events.name: endOfData

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Indicates if the data missing are before the start date or at the end

events.description: Indicates that we have reach the last week with data

methods.name: addCalendarEvent

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oCalendarEvent
parameters.description: The calendarEvent to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.me.OverlapCalendar itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the changeDate event of this sap.me.OverlapCalendar.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.me.OverlapCalendar itself.

Triggered when the displayed dates change

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the endOfData event of this sap.me.OverlapCalendar.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.me.OverlapCalendar itself.

Indicates that we have reach the last week with data

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Destroys all the calendarEvents in the aggregation calendarEvents.

methods.name: detachChangeDate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.name: indexOfCalendarEvent

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oCalendarEvent
parameters.description: The calendarEvent whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.me.OverlapCalendarEvent in the aggregation calendarEvents. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: insertCalendarEvent

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oCalendarEvent
parameters.description: The calendarEvent to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index the calendarEvent should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the calendarEvent is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the calendarEvent is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a calendarEvent into the aggregation calendarEvents.

methods.name: removeAllCalendarEvents

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation calendarEvents.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

methods.name: removeCalendarEvent

returnValue.description: The removed calendarEvent or null

parameters.name: vCalendarEvent
parameters.description: The calendarEvent to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Removes a calendarEvent from the aggregation calendarEvents.

methods.name: setFirstDayOffset

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property firstDayOffset.

Indicate how to offset the first day in regards to a Sunday (by default)

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 0.

methods.name: setShowOverlapIndicator

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showOverlapIndicator.

Do we want to display the overlap indicator

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setVisible

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property visible.

Indicates if we should render this component

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

parameters.name: iWeeksPerRow
parameters.description: The integer number of weeks per row

methods.name: setWidth

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property width.

The width of the calendar

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 100%.

symbols.name: sap.me.ProgressIndicator
symbols.description: Shows the progress of a process in a graphical way. The indicator can be displayed with or without numerical values. The filling can be displayed in color only, or additionally with the percentage rate. The indicator status can be interactive.

properties.name: barColor
properties.description: The color of the bar. Enumeration sap.ui.core.BarColor provides CRITICAL (yellow), NEGATIVE (red), POSITIVE (green), NEUTRAL (blue) (default value).

properties.name: displayValue
properties.description: The text value to be displayed in the bar.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Switches enabled state of the control. Disabled fields have different colors, and cannot be focused.

properties.name: percentValue
properties.description: The numerical value for the displayed length of the progress bar.

properties.name: showValue
properties.description: Specifies whether the current value shall be rendered inside the bar.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ProgressIndicator.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: sap.me.ProgressIndicator.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.me.ProgressIndicator with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Control.extend.

methods.name: getBarColor

returnValue.description: Value of property barColor

methods.description:
Gets current value of property barColor.

The color of the bar. Enumeration sap.ui.core.BarColor provides CRITICAL (yellow), NEGATIVE (red), POSITIVE (green), NEUTRAL (blue) (default value).

Default value is NEUTRAL.

methods.name: getDisplayValue

returnValue.description: Value of property displayValue

methods.description:
Gets current value of property displayValue.

The text value to be displayed in the bar.

Default value is 0%.

methods.name: getEnabled

returnValue.description: Value of property enabled

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enabled.

Switches enabled state of the control. Disabled fields have different colors, and cannot be focused.

Default value is true.

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

The numerical value for the displayed length of the progress bar.

Default value is 0.

returnValue.description: Value of property showValue

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showValue.

Specifies whether the current value shall be rendered inside the bar.

Default value is true.

returnValue.description: Value of property visible

methods.description:
Gets current value of property visible.

Invisible controls are not rendered

Default value is true.

methods.name: getWidth

methods.description:
Gets current value of property width.

The width of the control.

Default value is 100%.

The color of the bar. Enumeration sap.ui.core.BarColor provides CRITICAL (yellow), NEGATIVE (red), POSITIVE (green), NEUTRAL (blue) (default value).

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is NEUTRAL.

methods.name: setDisplayValue

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property displayValue.

The text value to be displayed in the bar.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 0%.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enabled.

Switches enabled state of the control. Disabled fields have different colors, and cannot be focused.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showValue.

Specifies whether the current value shall be rendered inside the bar.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setVisible

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property visible.

Invisible controls are not rendered

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property width.

The width of the control.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 100%.

symbols.name: sap.me.TabContainer
symbols.description: The TabContainer allow to stack 1 to 4 contents in a view with corresponding icons

properties.name: badgeAttachments
properties.description: The number to display in the badge for the attachments tab

properties.name: badgeInfo
properties.description: The number to display in the badge for the info tab

properties.name: badgeNotes
properties.description: The number to display in the badge for the notes tab

properties.name: badgePeople
properties.description: The number to display in the badge for the people tab

properties.name: expandable
properties.description: Indicates if the tab can be collapsed and expanded

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: Indicates if the actual tab is expanded or not

properties.name: selectedTab
properties.description: Return the index of the selected tab

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: fireSelect

returnValue.description: Whether or not to prevent the default action

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

methods.description:
Fires event select to attached listeners.

Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object.

methods.name: getExpandable

returnValue.description: Value of property expandable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property expandable.

Indicates if the tab can be collapsed and expanded

Default value is true.

methods.description:

Indicates if the actual tab is expanded or not

Default value is true.

symbols.title: class sap.me.TabContainer
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.15.0
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.15.0. The functionality of this control is merged with the sap.m.IconTabBar. Please use the sap.m.IconTabBar instead! This control will not be supported anymore.

nodes.name: sap.me
nodes.description: SAPUI5 library with controls specialized for mobile devices (extension).
